data.title: News — STATUS QUO
data.text:
Francis Rossi 2025 UK Tour.

We are delighted to announce the Francis Rossi UK 2025 Tour.

Join us for an evening of FR songs from the Status Quo songbook and more….

Tickets: www.aegpresents.co.uk/event/francis-rossi/

A strictly limited amount of VIP tickets will be available at each show, and will include: a pre-show Meet & Greet with Francis, personal photo opportunity (please bring your own phone/camera for this), signing opportunity for one of your own items, one of the best seats in the house for the show, and an exclusive tour merchandise item.

The VIP/Meet & Greet tickets will be available direct from the venue websites on 28th June.

Status Quo ‘Official Archive Series’ volume 3

‘Vol. 3 – Live At Westonbirt Arboretum’ is a further release of the Status Quo ‘Official Archive Series’ presenting the raw energy and infectious enthusiasm of a Status Quo live performance; no matter where in the world. With their trademark sound, powerful guitar riffs, and irresistible hooks, the band delivers an unadulterated rock ’n’ roll experience, and this collectible series is a great way to celebrate one of the greatest live acts of all time.

June 22nd, 2008, witnessed a momentous occasion at the National Arboretum Westonbirt. Rock legends, Status Quo, took the stage for the Forestry Commission's Live Music series, renowned for bringing popular music acts to enchanting forest settings.

Their electrifying performance proved to be a crowd-pleaser, keeping the audience on their feet from the very first note to the final chord. The setlist itself was a quintessential Quo blend, featuring both the band's timeless classics that have cemented their place in rock history and newer tracks showcasing their enduring creative spirit.

Beyond the stellar performance, the concert's magic was further amplified by the unique venue. The National Arboretum Westonbirt offers a wide variety of trees and plants amidst which the concert took place in a natural amphitheatre. The release of The Official Archive Series Vol. 3 is another opportunity to witness one of the world's most iconic rock bands perform live, surrounded by the majesty of nature, creating an unforgettable experience.

Out now: https://statusquo.tmstor.es/

FOR THE VERY FIRST TIME ON VINYL:

Francis said of the impending release, “It is great that ‘We Talk Too Much’ is getting a vinyl release. It looks fantastic. This album is close to my heart, it’s a different kind of sound to what I do with Quo, but I love this music. ‘Broken Memory’ also deserves to see the light of day, so I am glad we’ve been able to include that as an extra”.

Tracklisting:

LP Side A

01. I'll Take You Home

02. I’ve Tried Letting It Go

03. Oughta Know By Now

04. But I Just Said Goodbye

05. Waiting For Jesus

06. I'm Only Happy

LP Side B

01. Rearrange

02. I Talk Too Much

03. Heartbreaker

04. Good Times Bad Times

05. Sinking In Blue

06. Maybe Tomorrow

07. Broken Memory (Bonus Track)

OUT NOW: https://rossirickard.lnk.to/wetalktoomuch-lp

Rhino news - new solo album

We are delighted to announce that 'Just Sayin', the new album from John 'Rhino' Edwards, will be released worldwide by Molano Music on Friday, March 1, in the following formats: digipak CD (numbered limited edition of 1,000) and 140g black vinyl (hand-numbered and signed limited edition of 250).

Both formats are exclusively available from Rhino's official website and can be ordered here: http://www.rhinosrevenge.com/

Two T-shirt designs have also been added to the store.

Various videos promoting songs from the album can be viewed here: https://www.youtube.com/@RhinosRevenge

Piledriver whisky

Introducing: Status Quo’s Piledriver Blended Malt is a limited edition whisky bottling celebrating fifty years of the band’s acclaimed 1972 album Piledriver.

The 7-Year-Old Blended Malt whisky was specially chosen by Francis Rossi and Status Quo, under the tutelage of famed ex-Edrington blender Max Mcfarlane, to celebrate this impressive milestone in the band’s history, while capturing the spirit of this iconic musical era.

With delicate notes of Oloroso sherry cask, rich marzipan, and a slightly higher ABV, this whisky is equally suited for a night rocking out with old pals or spending a quiet one with your favourite records.

Limited to 500 bottles. On sale: Friday 8 December, 10 am: https://caskadedrinks.com/products/status-quo-piledriver

Official Archive Series vol.2 release news

Status Quo are delighted to announce the release of the second volume of the new ‘Official Archive Series’ brought to you by earMUSIC. ‘Vol. 2 - Live In London’ will be released on December 1st, 2023, once again as strictly limited and numbered 2CD and 3LP vinyl editions, as well as digital download and streaming.

The ‘Official Archive Series’ offers exceptional sound quality and great packaging throughout, featuring photography by Christie Goodwin. The Series has been newly mixed and mastered by Eike Freese and Laurin Halberstadt at Chameleon Studios Hamburg.

‘Vol. 2 - Live In London’ was a hometown show recorded on 19 December 2012 on the band’s ‘Quo Festive’ tour, getting people in to the pre-Christmas mood. The setlist at the O2 Arena saw Francis Rossi, Rick Parfitt, Andrew Bown, John ‘Rhino’ Edwards and Matt Letley [in his last UK show as Quo drummer] deliver an avalanche of classics, and even features a Christmas Medley, including ‘Walking In A Winter Wonderland’, ‘Rockin' Around The Christmas Tree’ and Quo’s own ‘It's Christmas Time’.

From today, Status Quo are providing a first musical preview with the digital release of the powerful live performance of ‘Rockin’ All Over The World’.

‘Vol. 2 – Live In London’ is a further release of the Status Quo ‘Official Archive Series’ presenting the raw energy and infectious enthusiasm of a Status Quo live performance; no matter where in the world. With their trademark sound, powerful guitar riffs, and irresistible hooks, the band delivers an unadulterated rock ’n’ roll experience, and this collectable series is a great way to celebrate one of the greatest live acts of all time

YT LINK: www.youtube.com/watch?v=P9zr8UzD-DQ

Album details here: www.ear-music.net/status-quo-catalogue/

‘Tunes & Chat’ features alternate takes on four Status Quo favourites, all written by Francis Rossi and Bob Young. ‘Spinning Wheel Blues’ and ‘April Spring Summer and Wednesdays’, both originally on 1970’s ‘Ma Kelly’s Greasy Spoon’ album, ‘In My Chair’, a non-album single from the same year, plus ‘And It’s Better Now’ from 1973’s ‘Hello!’.

Francis said of the release, “These are songs that mean a lot to me, and I wanted to revisit them. I’ve been doing just that on the ‘Tunes & Chat’ tour but I was keen to show them some more love. Collectors and lovers of Quo have always treasured vinyl editions and so do I; this record sounds and looks fantastic – the 10” format feels really special. The songs have been recorded in an informal but affectionate way, with some of the studio chatter retained. It’s been interesting to pick out a handful of favourites from my history and get to know them again more than 50 years down the line. Who knows, I might do it again.”

Official Archive Series vol.1 release news

Status Quo to announce the new 'Official Archive Series' starting with 'Vol. 1 - Live In Amsterdam' in August. This series features a curated selection of iconic Status Quo performances, showcasing their enduring popularity and musical uniqueness. With exceptional quality and future releases to come, this collectable series celebrates Status Quo's electrifying rock 'n' roll experience.

The iconic Status Quo are delighted to announce the release of the first volume of the new ‘Official Archive Series‘ brought to you by earMUSIC. ‘Vol. 1 - Live In Amsterdam’ will be released on 11 August 2023, on strictly limited and numbered CD and vinyl editions, as well as on digital formats. As with each forthcoming release in this series, this official and fully endorsed recording features a carefully curated selection of iconic Status Quo performances, including classic hits spanning their extensive catalogue, deep cuts and fan favourites. Each track is a testament to the band's enduring popularity and musical prowess. The next volume will be released in November and was recorded in London, so keep your eyes open for the following releases!

The ‘Official Archive Series’ will offer exceptional sound quality and great packaging throughout, featuring photography by Christie Goodwin. The Series has been freshly mixed and mastered by Eike Freese and Laurin Halberstadt at Chameleon Studios Hamburg.

‘Vol. 1 - Live In Amsterdam’ was recorded in the Dutch capital on 19 October 2010 on the band’s ‘Pictures Exposed World Tour’. The setlist at the Heineken Hall was representative of the rest of the ‘Pictures Exposed World Tour’ with the line-up of Francis Rossi, Rick Parfitt, Andrew Bown, John ‘Rhino’ Edwards and Matt Letley delivering an avalanche of Quo classics, as befitted a tour celebrating ‘40 Years of Hits’.

A first musical foretaste of the release of ‘Official Archive Series Vol. 1 - Live In Amsterdam’ is already available with the single ‘Beginning Of The End’, first released on the album ‘In Search Of The Fourth Chord’ in 2007.

Digital Single: www.StatusQuo.lnk.to/BeginningOfTheEnd

Album Pre-order:www.ear-music.net/status-quo-catalogue

The first release sets the bar high for what is due to follow, but each album in the Status Quo ‘Official Archive Series’ captures the raw energy and infectious enthusiasm of a Status Quo live performance; no matter where in the world. With their trademark sound, powerful guitar riffs, and irresistible hooks, the band delivers an unadulterated rock ’n’ roll experience, and this collectable series is a great way to celebrate one of the greatest live acts ever.

Status Quo – Official Archive Series Vol. 1 - Live In Amsterdam

Album release: 11 August 2023

Formats:

Ltd. 2CD Digipak

Ltd. 3LP (Black Vinyl/180g/Gatefold) Digital

Tracklisting:

CD 1

1. Intro

2. Caroline

3. Something 'Bout You Baby I Like 4. Rain

5. Don't Drive My Car

6. Mean Girl

7. Softer Ride

8. Beginning Of The End 9. Hold You Back

10. The Proposing Medley 11. The Oriental

12. Creepin' Up On You

CD 2

13. Living On An Island

14. In The Army Now

15. Drum Solo

16. Roll Over Lay Down

17. Down Down

18. Whatever You Want

19. Rockin' All Over The World

20. Junior's Wailing

21. Rock 'N' Roll Music / Bye Bye Johnny

Vinyl Side Split: A: 1-4; B: 5-8

C: 9-11; D: 12-15 E: 16-18; F: 19-21
